Title: Series: The Large Passion
Description: The Last Supper; Christ sits at the head of a large round table with his Apostles; He touches a goblet of wine; the Beloved Disciple, a young boy, sits with Jesus; after Dürer Woodcut
Producer name: Print made by: Jacob Cornelisz. van Oostsanen
Curator's comments: From a series of twelve woodcuts by Jacob Cornelisz. van Oostsanen (Hollstein 67-78); first published in circular frames in 1514 in Amsterdam. A second edition was published in 1517 with new rectangular frames lettered with Latin frases. A third edition was published with new rectangular frames with two small biblical scenes below the passion. A fourth edition with square ornamental frames was published by Johannes Mommart in 1651 in Brussels; this edition is titled: 'Man of Sorrows' which includes a copy after Durer on the title-page and the 'Crucifixion' block is replaced by 'Flight into Egypt' by Jacob Cornelisz. van Oostsanen. The BM has seven prints of the first edition (1837,0616.250; 1919,0616.58-62 and 1837,0616.249), nine print of the second edition (1911,0708.33-38; 1880,0612.209; 1856,0614.110 and 1867,0713.119), one print of the third edition (1917,0704.15) and fifteen prints of the fourth edition, of which two are separate (1922,0610.48 and 1919,0616.63) and thirteen are bound in a volume as a complete edition, see 157*.b.24 (1935,0214.9.1-13). Literature: H. Leeflang, in Daantje Meeuwissen (ed.), 'Jacob Cornelisz van Oostsanen (ca.1475-1533): De Renaissance in Amsterdam en Alkmaar', exh.cat. Amsterdam Museum and Stedelijk Museum Alkmaar, Zwolle, 2014, cat.no. 11.
Bibliographic references: New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (22.II)
Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (67)
Steinbart 1937 / Das Holzschnittwerk des Jakob Cornelisz von Amsterdam (20)
